alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 5:06AM EST until January 12 at 1:45AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Taylor, Crawford, Upson and Talbot Counties. Flint River near Griffin affecting Spalding and Fayette Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Peachtree City, Fayetteville, Peachtree City, Lovejoy, Americus, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. The backyards of homes at the end of Landing Way upstream from the bridge will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EST Thursday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 4.7 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.2 feet on 03/06/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued at 300 PM EST.this afternoon at 515 PM EST.
